value.title: Large U.S. school districts close as coronavirus cases rise
value.excerpt: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo identified a New York City suburb as a "hot spot" for coronavirus and the fifth-largest school district in California closed its doors as new cases of the illness continued to crop up and public health officials argued for a nationwide mitigation strategy.

value.title: Is it really a good idea to close schools to fight coronavirus?
value.excerpt: Students in the Lake Washington School District in the Seattle suburbs were so nervous about the novel coronavirus that they started a petition urging officials to close the schools. No one in a classroom had been diagnosed with the disease, but more than 15 people in the region had died of it, and students thought: Why take a chance?

value.title: Coronavirus Closures Hit Law Schools at Stanford, Columbia and Several Others
value.excerpt: Concerns over the spread of the coronavirus are beginning to upend law school operations, with more disruptions likely in the coming week. At least five law schools in New York, California and Washington State have now canceled in-person classes or closed outright amid worries that students and employees could be exposed to COVID-19.

value.title: Newmarket schools closed after staffer rode on bus with coronavirus patient
value.excerpt: Newmarket schools were closed Monday after a school employee rode on a bus with someone diagnosed with the COVID-19 coronavirus. value.excerpt: Villa Duchesne canceled classes on Monday after receiving word of the student’s connection with a coronavirus patient.
